meanings.definition: people or entities that work together or cooperate
meanings.sent1: The team of interoperatives completed the project successfully.
meanings.sent2: Interoperatives in the office collaborated on the new strategy.
meanings.sent3: The interoperatives at the party made sure everyone had a good time.
meanings.sent4: The interoperatives in the ecosystem maintained a delicate balance.
meanings.sent5: The concept of interoperatives emphasizes the power of teamwork.

meanings.definition: actions or processes that involve collaboration or coordination
meanings.sent1: Effective communication is key for smooth interoperatives.
meanings.sent2: The success of the event relied on careful interoperatives.
meanings.sent3: The dance routine was a perfect example of interoperatives in motion.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the clockwork moved in perfect interoperatives.
meanings.sent5: Interoperatives in the kitchen ensured the meal was prepared on time.

meanings.definition: systems or technologies that are able to communicate and work together efficiently
meanings.sent1: The new software aims to enhance interoperatives between departments.
meanings.sent2: Interoperatives between devices allow for seamless data transfer.
meanings.sent3: The robots' interoperatives were so smooth, it seemed like they were dancing.
meanings.sent4: The interconnected machines functioned in perfect interoperatives.
meanings.sent5: The concept of interoperatives in technology is revolutionizing industries.
